meanings.def: to rest your weight on your bottom with your back straight, for example on/in a chair
examples: She sat and stared at the letter in front of her.
+ adv./prep. May I sit here?
Don't just sit there—do something!
Just sit still!
He went and sat beside her.
the man who had sat next to me on the plane
She was sitting at her desk.
She always sits in that chair.
Four people sat around the table.
It’s too cold to sit outside.
The children were all sitting quietly and listening.
Make sure you are sitting comfortably, with your back straight and supported.
She came over to talk to us, leaving him sitting alone.
We asked the waiter for a bigger table so that we could all sit together.
sit doing something He just sits there watching the television.
We sat talking for hours.
I sat waiting for the soloist to walk onto the stage.
May I sit here?
Sit still, will you!
Please sit down.
Come in and sit yourselves down.
She was seated at the head of the table.
She perched herself on the edge of the bed.
Elmer was happily sitting in his high chair.
He sat bolt upright, hands folded in front of him.
He was sitting against the wall.
He would sit quietly and watch what was happening.
She sat demurely on the edge of her chair.
She sat under an apple tree.
She was sitting astride a horse.
The children sat cross-legged on the floor.
The manager sat behind his desk.
They sat opposite each other.
The kids sat around a campfire.
We sat at a table in the corner.
We sat in silence for a few moments.
We reached the hospital and were told to sit in the waiting room.
I can't just sit in front of the computer for hours.
He was sitting on the couch with a book when I got home.
She noticed the older man sitting across from her.

meanings.def: to put somebody in a sitting position
examples: He lifted the child and sat her on the wall.
She sat him down in front of the fire with a hot drink.

meanings.def: to be in a particular place
examples: + adv./prep. A large bus was sitting outside.
The pot was sitting in a pool of water.
I have an exercise bike just sitting at home not being used.
The jacket sat beautifully on her shoulders (= fitted well).
+ adj. The box sat unopened on the shelf.

meanings.def: to have an official position as something or as a member of something
examples: sit as something He was sitting as a temporary judge.
They both sat as MPs in the House of Commons.
sit in/on something She sat on a number of committees.
sit for something For years he sat for Henley (= was the MP for that constituency).

meanings.def: to meet in order to do official business
examples: Parliament sits for less than six months of the year.
sit something Candidates will sit the examinations in June.
Most of the students sit at least 5 GCSEs.
(especially North American English) sit for something He was about to sit for his entrance exam.

meanings.def: to rest on a branch, etc. or to stay on a nest to keep the eggs warm
to sit on its bottom with its front legs straight
examples: Rover! Sit!

meanings.def: to take care of babies or children for a short time while their parents are out
examples: Who's sitting for you?

meanings.def: to be in a good situation, especially when others are not
examples: With profits at record levels, the company’s certainly sitting pretty this year.

meanings.def: to feel so satisfied with what you have already achieved that you do not try to do any more
to admire somebody very much, especially a teacher or somebody from whom you try to learn
to sit or stand with your back straight
to seem right, natural, suitable, etc. in a particular place or situation
examples: His views did not sit comfortably with the management line.

meanings.def: to decide whether somebody’s behaviour is right or wrong, especially when you have no right to do this
examples: How dare you sit in judgement on me?

meanings.def: to avoid becoming involved in deciding or influencing something
examples: He tends to sit on the fence at meetings.

meanings.def: to do or say nothing to help somebody or deal with a difficult situation
examples: We can’t sit silently by and let them arrest him!

meanings.def: to stay where you are rather than moving away or changing position
examples: We sat tight and waited to be rescued.

meanings.def: to stay in the same situation, without changing your mind or taking any action
examples: Shareholders are being advised to sit tight until the crisis passes.
